summary: This is an email summarizing voluntary interviews conducted by OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY with three MCC employees regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details failures in protocol, including Epstein being left without a cellmate and missed inmate counts, and notes that several key officers declined to be interviewed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019. The document details the discovery of his body and the procedural failures surrounding his detention.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: The officer who was present when Epstein's body was discovered and who stated that Epstein had hung himself. She admitted to not conducting mandatory inmate counts.

persons.name: Lt. Jean
persons.context: An operations lieutenant at MCC who responded to the medical emergency call, found Epstein, and performed CPR. He questioned Officer Noel about the missing cellmate and missed counts.

connections.description: Lt. Jean was the supervising lieutenant who responded to the scene and questioned Officer Noel about protocol failures regarding Epstein's cellmate and missed counts.
Officer Noel was one of the officers on duty in the SHU and was present when Epstein's body was discovered. She admitted to procedural failures related to his supervision.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. He was found on the ground with two mattresses, and CPR was performed.

events.title: Epstein's Last Phone Call
events.description: An MCC employee assisted Epstein in making an unrecorded legal phone call from the SHU showers. Epstein stated he was calling his mother but was overheard speaking to a male individual.

events.title: Interviews of MCC Staff
events.description: OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY conducted voluntary interviews with three MCC employees regarding the circumstances leading to Epstein's death, revealing multiple protocol failures.

keyFacts: Epstein was found dead in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019. Officer Noel stated he had 'hung himself' and admitted she and others 'messed up' by not conducting mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts.

Epstein was supposed to have a cellmate at all times following a prior suicide attempt, but his cellmate had been moved and he was alone overnight. Officer Noel initially claimed not to know where the cellmate was.
Security cameras in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where Epstein was held were not working at the time of his death, a fact some staff were unaware of.
The day before his death, an MCC employee assisted Epstein in making an unrecorded phone call on a legal line. Epstein said he was calling his mother but was overheard speaking to a man.
Several key officers, including the two who discovered Epstein's body, declined to be interviewed by investigators, and others requested union representation before speaking.
